ATTRIBUTE.NAME: Lookup Sql Override
ATTRIBUTE.VALUE: select aa.CASINOLOCDETID as CASINOLOCDETID, aa.CASINOLOC as CASINOLOC, aa.TBLAREA as TBLAREA, aa.SiteID as SiteID from ( SELECT D_CASINOLOCATIONDET.CASINOLOCDETID, case loctypcode when 'T' then 1 when 'S' then 1 when 'B' then 2 when 'C' then 2 when 'F' then 2 when 'O' then 2 when 'R' then 2 when 'U' then 9 else 5 end as SctyCde, D_CASINOLOCATIONDET.CASINOLOC, D_CASINOLOCATIONDET.TBLAREA, D_CASINOLOCATIONDET.SiteID FROM D_CASINOLOCATIONDET) aa order by siteid asc, casinoloc asc, SctyCde asc, casinolocdetid desc --

WORKLET.DESCRIPTION:
PURPOSE This Session Worklet manages the deletions of records from the F_Promotion_Transaction table via the mappings m_PromotionTransaction_DELE and spm_BatchUpdate_F_PROMOTION_TRANSACTION_DELE.
PREDECESSORS None
SUCCESSORS None
NOTES Promotions are deleted when they attract a VOID status (Legacy Status Code) on SYCO, meaning that they were a mistake and should be treated as though they never existed. VOIDs may come through days after the promotion was erroneously issued, so this worklet is required to delete them.
WORKLET.NAME: wkl_Promotion_Transaction_Delete

WORKLET.DESCRIPTION:
PURPOSE This Session Worklet manages the transformation of fact table F_Promotion_Transaction via the mappings m_PromotionTransaction, spm_Load_F_PROMOTION_TRANSACTION, and spm_BatchUpdate_F_PROMOTION_TRANSACTION.
PREDECESSORS wkl_Promotion_Transaction
SUCCESSORS None
NOTES This worklet obtains Expired Promotion Transactions by checking for promotions in CDW that expire today, but have not yet been redeemed. Therefore it is necessary to load wkl_Promotion_Transaction first, in case it contains a Redeemed transaction, or in case it contains an Issued transaction that expired on the same day.
WORKLET.NAME: wkl_Promotion_Transaction_Expired

WORKLET.DESCRIPTION:
PURPOSE This Session Worklet manages the transformation and load of the W_Promotion work table via the mappings m_Promotion, spm_BatchUpdate_W_PROMOTION and spm_Load_W_PROMOTION.
PREDECESSORS None
SUCCESSORS wkl_Promotion_Transaction
NOTES The W_Promotion work table contains a single entry for each legacy (SYCO) promotion, whereas F_Promotion_Transaction contains an entry for each Issue / Redemption / Expiry of a promotion. W_Promotion is necessary for the F_Promotion_Transaction transformation so that we can tell whether a promotion has already been issued / redeeemed / expired / deleted. It also contains denormalised flags that identify the promotion as one of interest, such as EGM Free Credits. This saves us from having to determine whether a promotion is an EGM Free Credit whenever that logic is required. W_Promotion is loaded with all of this information BEFORE F_Promotion_Transaction. It is possible that the two tables could get out of synch if transactions are rejected in F_Promotion_Transaction, but loaded into W_Promotion. This is considered an acceptable risk, as W_Promotion is deemed to contain current record of a promotion according to SYCO.
WORKLET.NAME: wkl_Promotion

WORKLET.DESCRIPTION:
PURPOSE This group worklet manages the execution of all Promotions Fact Table transformations. This includes the F_Promotion_Transaction and W_Promotion tables.
PREDECESSORS wkl_SYCOBasedDimensions
SUCCESSORS wkl_PreAggregate
NOTES Although they are logically independent, wkl_PromotionTransaction_Delete and wkl_Promotion_Transaction are serialised because they transform the same table (F_Promotion_Transaction). wkl_Promotion is vital for the correct execution of wkl_Promotion_Transaction for many reasons: (1) To discard deleted promotions. (2) To validate redeemed/expired promotions have been issued.
WORKLET.NAME: wkl_Promotion_Facts
